definition: to offer humbly (written at the end of letter from sb of lower status to higher status)/your humble servant
to respect/to venerate/to salute/to offer
surname Zhu
to wish/to express good wishes/to pray/(old) wizard

sentences.english: Congratulations from the entire Wang family. We wish you joy and happiness in your little daughter.
sentences.chinese: 王家全体成员恭喜您们生了千金，敬祝幸福快乐。

sentences.english: Witn my best wishes for your future happiness.
Wish the elderly rejuvenation and youth forever.
sentences.chinese: 敬祝这些长者们返老还童，永远年轻。

sentences.english: With my best wishes for your future happiness.
Let us drink to the health of Ms. Kelland.
sentences.chinese: 让我们共同举杯，敬祝凯兰女士健康。

definition: to congratulate respectfully/to wish good luck and success (esp. to a superior)/with best wishes (in writing)
to have all one's wishes (idiom)/best wishes/all the best/may all your hopes be fulfilled
to offer one's congratulations (formal)
to present respectfully/with (sb's) compliments/complimentary
yours truly/yours sincerely (at the end of a letter)
Happy New Year!
(used at the end of a letter to introduce a polite salutation)
Live as long as the Zhongnan Mountains! (idiom)/Long may you live!
may your happiness be as immense as the East Sea (idiom)
may you enjoy boundless longevity (idiom)/long may you live
respect and love
to express/to present/to extend/to tender (greetings, thanks etc)
heartfelt/wholehearted/cordial
to drink a toast
to express good wishes
(idiom) amiability leads to harmony
